Name: Utility Rate - Flat

Caption.String: In Value mode, enter a rate in real terms because SAM applies both escalation and inflation to the total first-year electricity bill to calculate the annual electricity bill in later years. In Schedule mode, enter rates in nominal terms because inflation does not apply. See Help for details.

Download rate structures for electric utility companies included in the OpenEI Utility Rate Database. After downloading a rate structure, compare the inputs below with a copy of the rate sheet to verify that the information is correct.

For front-of-meter systems, only the Buy All / Sell All metering option is available to define energy buy rates for electricity purchases to charge the battery, meet inverter nighttime consumption, solar field freeze protection, or any other electricity required when the system is not generating electricity.
This rate from the URDB contains items that SAM's electricity bill calculator does not consider. See Unused Items below.

Description.String: Type an escalation rate (%) for each year. Each year's rate applies to the first-year electricity cost. Inflation does not apply.

Caption.String: Use hourly (subhourly) buy rates instead of TOU rates
Use hourly (subhourly) sell rates instead of TOU rates

Items.StringList: Net energy metering|Net energy metering with $ credits|Net billing|Net billing with carryover to next month|Buy all / sell all

Caption.String: Roll over net excess compensation to future bills
Go to Open EI Utility Rate Database website...

Description.String: An array of $/kWh buy rates for each time step.
An array of $/kWh sell rates for each time step.

ur_metering_option.Label: Metering option
ur_metering_option.IndexLabels: Net energy metering|Net energy metering with $ credits|Net billing|Net billing with carryover to next month|Buy all / sell all

ur_nm_credit_month.Label: Month for end of true-up period

ur_nm_credit_rollover.Label: Roll over net excess compensation to future bills

ur_nm_yearend_sell_rate.Label: Compensation rate for net excess generation

msgbox('Metering option not valid for FOM Battery!\nThe rate data you are loading uses the ' + metering_options[value('ur_metering_option')] + ' metering option. Please check the rate data to verify that it is appropriate for your analysis.');

dc_billing_demand_periods[i][1] = 1; // Assume all perionds are included in billing demand (not represented in URDB as of V8)
